page.title: 02GOVAN SPEECH
page.content: In this area{Standard English}is the {language}of written communication but the{language}of speech varies from English with a Scottish accent to a complex{Glasgow dialect.} Glasgow dialect is abrasive and vigorous but withers transliteration. Its sources are many : traditional Scots, local idioms, new coinages, often American in origin, rhyming slang, expletives. It is kept alive in the streets and playgrounds. Its particular strenth is the slick retort, to puncture arrogance, and in the{language}of aggression. There is an elaborate code of challenge and counter-challenge developed amoungst teenagers to establish readiness for a fight. In adulthood, particularly amoungst the upwardly mobile, dialect is reduced and{language}becomes more standardised.
